description: Smallest prime p in set of 4 consecutive primes in arithmetic progression with common difference 6n.
links: Index entries for sequences related to primes in arithmetic progressions
example: 642427,642457,642487,642517 are consecutive primes with 3 consecutive gaps of 30
prog: (PARI) np(p, d=[N, N, N])={p=[p, 0, 0]; while(p[1]<MAX&&p+d!=p=[nextprime(p[1]+1), p[1], p[2]], ); p[3]-d[3]}; p=0; np=vector(1, i, p=np(p+1)); \\ after _M. F. Hasler_ in A052243; Graziano Aglietti (mg5055(AT)mclink.it), Aug 22 2010
crossrefs: Initial terms of sequences A033451, A033447, A033448, A052242, A052243, ...
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 31 2000
extensions: The term for n=7 is 23921257 and not 23921299 Graziano Aglietti (mg5055(AT)mclink.it), Aug 22 2010
Add more terms and correct the seventh term Graziano Aglietti (mg5055(AT)mclink.it), Aug 22 2010
